trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot Azure BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot Azure BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: When troubleshooting <token>af_integration_full</token>, you can use Tracking in the <token>tpm_full</token> and use the Debug logs stored in the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When troubleshooting <token>af_integration_full</token>, you can use Tracking in the <token>tpm_full</token> and use the Debug logs stored in the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides information on using the Tracking and Debug logs.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides information on using the Tracking and Debug logs.

trans-unit.source: Tracking
trans-unit.target: Tracking

trans-unit.source: Every time the message sending client gets a response (whether it’s a failure or a success), the response header includes a tracking ID.
trans-unit.target: Every time the message sending client gets a response (whether it’s a failure or a success), the response header includes a tracking ID.

trans-unit.source: In cases where there is a failure, you can extract this tracking ID from the header and use the <link xlink:href="100d9ba7-0ebc-40bf-8b5f-92641c9639ba" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages</link> feature in <token>tpm_full</token> to troubleshoot.
trans-unit.target: In cases where there is a failure, you can extract this tracking ID from the header and use the <link xlink:href="100d9ba7-0ebc-40bf-8b5f-92641c9639ba" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages</link> feature in <token>tpm_full</token> to troubleshoot.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet demonstrates how to extract the tracking ID from the response:
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet demonstrates how to extract the tracking ID from the response:

trans-unit.source: Debug Logs
trans-unit.target: Debug Logs

trans-unit.source: During the development process, debug logs are available in the WADLogsTable in the Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: During the development process, debug logs are available in the WADLogsTable in the Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: To view these log files, you can use the following tools:
trans-unit.target: To view these log files, you can use the following tools:

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: Browsing Storage Resources with Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: Browsing Storage Resources with Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: The debug log files include the following events:
trans-unit.target: The debug log files include the following events:

trans-unit.source: Loading an assembly
trans-unit.target: Loading an assembly

trans-unit.source: Adding or updating an artifact, like a Transform
trans-unit.target: Adding or updating an artifact, like a Transform

trans-unit.source: Adding, updating, or deleting Bridge Configuration
trans-unit.target: Adding, updating, or deleting Bridge Configuration

trans-unit.source: Message submitted to the Bridge pipeline
trans-unit.target: Message submitted to the Bridge pipeline

trans-unit.source: Bridge stages including their Begin Execute and End Execute events
trans-unit.target: Bridge stages including their Begin Execute and End Execute events

trans-unit.source: Faults
trans-unit.target: Faults

trans-unit.source: Windows Azure BizTalk Services tool in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Windows Azure BizTalk Services tool in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The Windows Azure BizTalk Services tool is available as an Extension in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Azure BizTalk Services tool is available as an Extension in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Using this tool, you can debug your bridge by sending a test message.
trans-unit.target: Using this tool, you can debug your bridge by sending a test message.

trans-unit.source: The tool steps through the different stages of your bridge and shows the status after each stage.
trans-unit.target: The tool steps through the different stages of your bridge and shows the status after each stage.

trans-unit.source: The tool also displays the individual tracking events with any errors.
trans-unit.target: The tool also displays the individual tracking events with any errors.

trans-unit.source: To add this tool:
trans-unit.target: To add this tool:

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio project, go to the <embeddedLabel>Tools</embeddedLabel> menu, and select <embeddedLabel>Extensions and Updates</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio project, go to the <embeddedLabel>Tools</embeddedLabel> menu, and select <embeddedLabel>Extensions and Updates</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Online</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Online</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Search, type <legacyBold>BizTalk</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In Search, type <legacyBold>BizTalk</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Explorer</embeddedLabel> from the list and download/install.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Explorer</embeddedLabel> from the list and download/install.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, <embeddedLabel>Windows Azure BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> is listed.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, <embeddedLabel>Windows Azure BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> is listed.

trans-unit.source: You may have to close/reopen Visual Studio for it to display.
trans-unit.target: You may have to close/reopen Visual Studio for it to display.
